comment: I took this class about a year ago. It was straight forward she would explain what to do and you would do what she said. She graded fairly however the tests were difficult (study the labs). She let us leave once we completed the lab which was nice because I took the 8pm class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had her for lab and it wasn't too bad. For the lab reports, make sure you follow the rubric closely and you should be fine. Tests are a little hard, but they're not cumulative and very doable if you study the labs and pay attention to what she explains before lab. Otherwise she's a very sweet person in general and very reasonable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lectures most classes, but just take notes on the PowerPoints if you miss a class its no big deal. Tests are a huge chunk of your grade, barely any homework assignments are given. Shes nice, helpful, and replies to emails. I dont like biology, but this class wasnt too bad. Just STUDY for exams!!!! Im a horrible test taker, barely passed!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I dislike Biology, and this was surprisingly not painful at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Good teacher, made the class a lot less difficult than I expected. Tests make up the vast majority of your grade, but they're pretty easy and she provides helpful study guides. Great lab professor as well. Very helpful and a fair grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I had her for lab and lecture. Very, very difficult professor. She cannot teach. Just reads off powerpoints and never explains anything. Her tests are extremely difficult. The lab was way easier but we still had to work for it.

BIO 1 lab is probably the easiest lab I've taken so far, so sometimes it got a little boring in the material. She always made labs enjoyable and interesting even when they didn't seem to be. She's a new graduate, very knowledgeable and helpful. Final is difficult so use her study guide, and always ask questions if you don't know something.
